reviewText: After playing this and the first Thrillville on my PSP, seeing this on the Steam store brought a wave of childhood memories. Buying this game will be one of the greatest decisions of your life. You can engage in conversations with anyone in the park and can even have relationships. The coaster building and park management mechanics are also very well done.

reviewText:
What's sad is that the minigames are better than some of the crap on the steam store nowadays. @-@

+
-Simple, easy and fun for any audience.
-Colourful graphics
-Social interaction is cool
-Decent minigames
-Fun (perhaps a little chessy) music to match the feeling of the game

-
-Not very challenging
-Limited amount of space for building

That's all I can think of. I played this game forever seven years ago. :D

Tl;dr: Buy if you want a fun, simple theme park sim. Don't if you want a challenge.

reviewText: This game , IN MY OPINION, is BETTER than rollercoaster tycoon, With Nostalgia, it brings social Intercation, Cool Rides, a Wacky Scientist named Mortimer who looks like the guy from back to the Future,and overall, the best thing is the park itself, or PARKS, with an s, YUP, there are a total of 5 dif. Parks to play all with 3 areas with totally different genres. the 5 parks are, Thrillville Stunts, the Starter park based on action (duh),Which contains the areas Throttleville, Battleville,and Saddleville (cowboys). then there is Thrillville Explorer, which contains Relicville, Summitville, and Scurvyville ( WOO PIRATES!!!!!). then Thrillville Other worlds, with Uragiville,Astroville, and Oceanville. Thrillville Giants is next, with Candyville,LawnVille, and Casaville. FINALLY there is Thrillville Holidays, with Fallville, Winterville, and Summerville. the only downside is that it is kinda short.

reviewText:
Love this game.

Everything about this game I love but it's missing multiplayer and that would be amazing in this game creating together, solving some missions together and even going past the restrictions and making something amazing.

I would love to see a thrillville 3. (Edited to stop people freaking out :))

Graphics: The game is kinda old now so the graphics are dated but they are fitting for this game and if changed, would ruin the game and for that the graphics make the game unique.

Audio: The audio for the game are funny to listen too, helpful to listen and also really relaxing and extremely entertaining.

Controls: Controls are extremely simple to get used too and really cannot judge or anything. Super amazing.

He best thing about this game is the mini games. You create a massive theme park and you are able to interact with everything from cleaning up litter to entertaining the crowd to riding a roller coaster to playing the arcade games.

I have no problems with this game and is worth the money you pay for it.

reviewText: I had a lot of fun playing both Thrillville and Thrillville: Off the Rails on my PS2. Seeing as how I currently don't have access to a PS2, I had to get OTR on Steam. It's a very fun game, and well worth some of your time. It's similar to Rollercoaster Tycoon, but Thrillville concentrates on more of the theme park in general rather than just rollercoasters (although those are still fun as hell). Managing a theme park is made perfect and simple in Thrillville. While there are definitely some downsides (limited energy for each park??), I think OTR is one for the books.

reviewText:
A very fun game.  Especially great if you played it on PS2 a while back when it came out.  Not as fun these days, but I find myself playing it longer than I thought I would.

Pros:
-The rollercoaster building system is great, kind of weird at first, but if using a controller, it becomes easier.
-Since it's a PS2 game, there's nothing to buy, no DLC.  Everything's included.  The arcade games could be full games with a little modifying.  They're not just thrown in, they're nicely thought out, and they're fun.  One's even a 3D flying game, with great controls.
-Can talk to guests.
-Custom rollercoasters.
-Run around your park in third person.
-Interesting parks

Cons:
-Power Meter gets annoying.
-INVERT CAMERA MEANS THAT IN THE FLYING GAME, YOU HAVE UNIVERTED CONTROLS ON THE LEFT STICK.  WHY.
-No decorating like RCT.
-Can have only one of each arcade game, but that's fine because of the power meter annoyance.
-No landscaping like RCT.
-Customization could be better, but it was a PS2 game, though the PC version -could- have been upgraded in some way.  Though, looking at the date of the game, I really can't blame it too much.  What could have been added to make it better?  Not anything I can think of without changing the game entirely.
-No tunnels for rollercoasters.
-Only building in predetermined areas.

Overall:
A fun game with not much in the way of you and having fun.  Even though I said there were all these flaws, it's fun.  And they're only really flaws" because I'm used to RCT."

reviewText: It might be impossible to be bored with this game! I bought it because of nostalgia, and I play it for fun. Thrillville OTR is challenging and offers a wide variety of minigames and tasks while you build and customize many different theme parks. The story is fine, I don't particularly care for it much. A sappy corporate rival park builder is a threat to stealing your visitors and you have to just build better parks and show Globo Joy" who's boss.\n\nI personally dislike the high graphics setting because it makes the character models look creepy. I recommend putting graphics down a notch and disabling voice. It gives a more classic feel to it and it also forces you to actually read the dialogue
date: which I actually rather do. Check this one out. Ten bucks and it's basically 35 games in one. Can't go wrong!"

reviewText: I remember getting this hame for the PS2 back in 2007, man it was so good, a Theme Park Tycoon Game that featured so much more, everything from building the rollercoasters with crazy addons and features such as sudden drops to having the coaster go into a cannon and shoot the park attendents into the air only to have them parachute down. You even get to ride the rides yourself after that you can roam around the park talk to your guests make the feel welcome get opnions on how ur park is doing and what you can do to make it even better. The game is loaded complete with its own minigames to simulate playing the arcades at a real life amusment park the viraity is so well done can keep you busy for hours. The game's has a solid soundtrack with a original radio channel in the main game called PARK radio with its own DJ and all you can defentaly tell they put effort into it. The only con I could think of is they not made a third game this series is long due for a third entry.

reviewText:
I really want to give this game a recommendation, but there is just one problem with this game: CONTROLS

I loved the original Thrillville as a kid and when i saw the 2nd one was on Steam, i had to pick it up. I do love this game, but the controls have made me rage quit multiple times now.

Seriously, for about 80% of the mini games, the controls are so delayed it makes beating the game missions insanely difficult. I use both an Xbox 360 controller and a mouse + keyboard, yet there is a 2-3 second delay, or the game will just not respond at all.

This only occurs in the mini games, so i know it isn't on my end. I can run around the park and build coasters just fine, but i can't finish all the missions due to certain mini games being just being impossibly difficult with these awful controls.

This game is so great and I just want to play the hell out of it and soak in some nostalgia. Yet, I can't recommend due to the state of the controls.
voteText: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I bought this like many others from the fun I remember having with the first game on the Xbox when it came out.

Before I begin I want to say that I am not recommending this game not because of its gameplay, but more because of its lack of improvement. It's not a bad game.

Pros:
-- Like the first one, the game is great for kids. It's simple and easy to learn. Most of it is social interaction and fulfilling ride challanges.

-- Interaction with all aspects of the park. Whether it's training employeess managing park finances, or playing minigames, you can still control your park.

Cons:
--This is EXACTLY like the first game. The mechanics haven't changed at all and I felt like I was paying for an expansion more than a sequel. It actually got rather boring.

--Lack of freedom with rides. This was the same problem with the first game. SimCoaster, SimTheme Park, and RollerCoaster Tycoon didn't force you to build only in dedicated zones as well as have a power" bar to limit your complexity on the park
date:
making ride creativity less than fun because you always had to worry about power management.


For the TL;DR: this game is exactly like the first one. If you want a game that's fun for kids
recommended: buy it. If you want a better amusement park game in nearly every single aspect

reviewText: Animated cut-scenes looked great but the character sprites in the actual game did not. Their facial expressions were creepy and they constantly repeated lines. The mini games didn't have very good instructions so things didn't make sense. For example the dance mini game didn't really explain what the symbols actually meant and how to hit some of the directions (if that made any sense). Overall, the game is actually very good and addicting. You get to create your character and even name him/her. For some reason children can also manage the theme park. The missions were really well done and it gave me something to do in the park if I got bored. Also, the game uses REAL music instead of music specifically designed for the game. For example they used Natasha Bedingfeild's (I think I misspelled it) Unwritten song and Toby Mac's I'll be for You." The only major problem with this game is the character sprite design and the lack of explanation in the mini games. Keep in mind this is really just a cheap version of Roller Coaster Tycoon with a story line. Granted it is worth $10 and I would recommend this game for you or a friend."

reviewText:
Thrillville: OTR is pretty good but not that bad

PROS:
The roller coaster creator is easy to use
Tons of mini-games
The ability to interact with park guests
Decent Graphics

CONS:
Awkward Camera
Some of the mini-games have poo controls
Random Crashes
The background music grows stale and annoying rather quickly

7/10
Would make a 70 dollar roller coaster again

reviewText: I wish the original Thrillville was available for steam but the sequel is just as good. You basically build themeparks, eack park has three different themes to choose from, there are also mini games and side missions and of course building rollarcoasters. Its not as detailed as RTC or anything but that actually plays to the games strengths and you never get bored since there are plenty of other things to do besides build. I loves the original for PS2 but the PC port of the sequel works very well.
